data.title: Implement getTextInput for iOS.
data.body: Contains getTextInput for iOSInput implemented with UIAlertView. Tested with monotouch evaluation and iPhone emulator. I hope it's right.

data.title: New3dapi, basic renderer
data.body: Intended for testing only.

data.title: Implement getTextInput for iOS.
data.body: Contains getTextInput for iOS implemented with UIAlertView. Tested with monotouch evaluation and iPhone emulator. I hope it's right.

data.title: Detailed Ray-AABB intersection
data.body: Added math.Intersector.intersectRayBounds, a more method that gives more details about a ray-aabb intersection.

data.title: Fix edge case where PixmapPacker eats all memory in infinite recursion
data.body: Please check if I got this right; there is no test for it, and I can't seem to use my own libgdx build in my game right now.

data.title: Material, some small changes
data.body:
I had some small problems with my existing code and the new 3d changes and needed to change the Material class a bit.
- Implement Iterable<MaterialAttribute> now the Array isn't accessible anymore.
- Add hasTexture (like needBlending) flag, useful i.e. for enabling/disabling TEXTURE2D on GLES1.
- Cleanup duplicate code.
- Allow adding and removing multiple attributes at once.
- Convenience methods for getting attributes by class type.
- Add #setShader(), not sure how its intended to set the shader without this, but can easily changed if needed.

data.title: Fix #1186: GdxNativesLoader.extractLibrary overwriting existing .so
data.body: Fix for [issue 1186](http://code.google.com/p/libgdx/issues/detail?id=1186) by only extracting a native library into /tmp if it doesn't already exist.

data.title: Bullet, use Model instead of Mesh
data.body:
I just pulled the 3D changes and notices that the bullet tests don't work anymore. It's because the ObjLoader now returns multiple submeshes. So I updated the tests to use models instead of meshes and changed bullet to allow direct construction from a model (it's very easy to work with now).

I haven't looked into the SoftMeshTest yet.

It also contains some minor changes to the 3D stuff for easy constructing a still submodel (by default it has no material, which gives a npe).

And the test use performancecounters now.

data.title: iOS: ObjectAL updates, OpenGL context updates
data.body:
This contains my updates for ObjectAL support and issues I had with OpenGL context getting lost.  As previously mentioned, it's the result of using the hg-git extension with Mercurial.  Hopefully it didn't screw anything up too badly.

I do know that a build.xml includes some localized changes that may cause problems for other people.  That was in a separate branch in Mercurial, but I think the extension brought it in anyway.  Oh well.

Good luck.
--tim

data.title: Ouya-Backend
data.body: A simple ouya backend. It's only a input wrapper to manage input from ouya controller and right ouya application init .

data.title: Minor updates in G3D
data.body:
- LightShader configured in enum
- normalTextureFlag added
- Bounding box setLocation(x,y,z) added

data.title: FreeTypeFontGenerator to generate single characters
data.body:
I would like to support other alphabets than latin too, so that is why I cannot generate all required characters in the beginning when my game starts. That's why I created this simple function, that can create Glyph and Bitmap objects for single characters. Then I can use it to update Texture object(s) in my own Font object.

I know many of you will say that this is very slow method, but I've been using this principle both in desktop with C++ and in Android with Java, and I've never had any performance problems with it.

I also added small function that can be used to calculate "real" height of font. This was in older TTF-library (stb-truetype), but I didn't found it from this new one.

And sorry if my coding style is ugly. This is my first pull request ever and Java is kind of new to me too.

data.title: ObjectAL from tescott changes
data.body: Just the pull request with the changes to have ObjectAL working on iOS, extracted from tescott github project. I don't know if he improved the stuff in his own fork.

data.title: Adding to ShaderProgram the ability to set an array of matrices from a float buffer.
data.body: This is useful for 3d bone animation.

data.title: gdx-setup-ui fix.
data.body: Fixes the gdx-setup-ui to actually point to the right config files :)

data.title: Bullet, small change to the tests
data.body: Includes https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/pull/178 also.

data.title: Fix timing.
data.body: Fix stupid mistake I made.

data.title: G3D Major refactoring
data.body:
Started refactoring G3D from model loaders branch (as discussed). So far I've brought over the minimum to make it work with core:
- Moved model, loaders (md2, obj), material to core
- Updated existing tests to work with new loaders
- Removed old loaders
- Removed md5 loader & related files (old Material, Animation)

Everything seems to work fine so far. Just wanted to get a Pull Request started so everyone can chip in on any changes/modifications I have to do while moving to core.

Next step on my list would be to add a few Tests that show new model loaders & material functionality. From there I was going to look at bringing ModelRenderer & Lighting and other experimental stuff over (as we flesh them out).

Thoughts?

data.title: Add FloatCounter, PerformanceCounter and PerformanceCounters.
data.body: Some simple classes to keep track of the time and load one or more tasks take.

data.title: Add Application#getDeviceinfo
data.body: Adds access to some basic device information.

data.title: IOSServerSocket Bugfix: Local IP Address Resolution
data.body: The old way to obtain the local IP address on iOS does not work anymore. It will produce crashes on iOS 6+. This fixes the problem.

data.title: Math files small cleaning
data.body:
Maybe useless as usual from me, maybe not.
Tested, working

data.title: Added setCurrentTime(0) to IOSMusic.stop()
data.body: Sorry the extra code formatting, am I the only one using libgdx code formatter or I have the wrong formatter and I keep destroying the correct code format all the time?

data.title: Android Daydream
data.body:
Added support for Android Daydream in Android backend, including a test.

Luckily, Daydream is much more straightforward than LiveWallpaper, so if you diff `AndroidDaydream` vs. `AndroidApplication`, and `AndroidGraphicsDaydream` vs. `AndroidGraphics` you'll see they are almost identical.

By the way, requires API Level 17 (Android 4.2).

data.title: Corrected method name NewStringUTF instead of NewStringUTF8
data.body: Corrected spelling. Built and tested this go around.

data.title: Added getFailureReason to Gdx2DPixmap
data.body:
Looks like my fork was several commits behind :) Try now. 

This adds getFailureReason to Gdx2DPixmap to display the contents of const char *failure_reason in stb_image.c if it fails to load an image. I originally had an issue loading a progressive jpeg which isn't supported by stb_image.c. For new comers like myself, we can now see why stb_image failed to load an image.

data.title: Update gdx/src/com/badlogic/gdx/graphics/g3d/decals/SimpleOrthoGroupStra...
data.body:
...tegy.java

compare method must return 0 while equals.

data.title: Added getFailureReason to Gdx2DPixmap
data.body:
Passes the const char\*  'failure_reason' from stb_image to a Exception in Gdx2dPixmap if something goes wrong when loading an image. 

I just started using libgdx and the first problem I ran into was attempting to load a 'progressive' jpeg which, after some time digging into libgdx, turns out isn't supported. I hope this will help new comers like myself determine why an image failed to load.
